page.title: 20Southend fore-shore
page.content: The fore-shore inspectors take care of ten miles of fore-shore extending one mile out from the sea wall. There are sixteen men to do this. If you want to rent a chalet it costs you Â£160 per season. There are 18 chalets in our area, 9 in Westcliff and 9 in Southend. All have glass doors, 4 chairs,a table and a carpet. The beach is man-made. If they run out of sand they have to bring some more on lorries. Mooring a boat costs Â£20.76 a year. Bait digging is allowed more than quarter of a mile from the shore. There is a fine of up to Â£200 for digging too close. There are three first aid stations, and no free parking anywhere. Written by Karen Lang (10yrs)
